conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the system and conditions for elevator and piston movement.
Calculate weight of the cylinder: 45 N.
Calculate weight of the piston: 30 N.
Maximum tension in the rope is 120 N.
Maximum piston distance occurs when elevator accelerates upwards at maximum possible acceleration without breaking the rope.
Total weight of cylinder and piston: 75 N.
Net force when elevator accelerates upwards: 45 N.
Total mass of the system: 7.5 kg.
Calculate effective pressure inside the cylinder: 1.06 x 10⁵ Pa.
Apply Boyle's Law: product of pressure and volume is constant for a given mass of gas at constant temperature.
New volume V₂: L₂ x S.
Using Boyle's Law, solve for L₂: approximately 18.21 cm.
Maximum distance piston can reach from bottom of cylinder: approximately 18.21 cm.
